Package it.polimi.ingsw.am49.server.model.players

Class PlayerBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am49.server.model.players.PlayerBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PlayerBoard extends Object implements Serializable
The personal board of the player, where he places the cards
See Also:

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final Map<Symbol,Integer>
    availableResources
    Is a Map<Symbol, Integer> used to keep track of the resources that are available on the board.
    private final BoardTile[][]
    board
    The board of every player is saver in a matrix of boardtiles.
    private final List<BoardTile>
    placementOrder
    Is used to save the order in witch the cards are placed on the board to facilitate handing of the cards.
    private final BoardTile
    starterTile
    Saves the starter tile for each player.

  • Field Details

    • board

      private final BoardTile[][] board
      The board of every player is saver in a matrix of boardtiles.
      See Also:
      • BoardTile

    • placementOrder

      private final List<BoardTile> placementOrder
      Is used to save the order in witch the cards are placed on the board to facilitate handing of the cards.

    • starterTile

      private final BoardTile starterTile
      Saves the starter tile for each player.

    • availableResources

      private final Map<Symbol,Integer> availableResources
      Is a Map<Symbol, Integer> used to keep track of the resources that are available on the board.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerBoard

      public PlayerBoard(StarterCard starterCard)
      Constructor for the PlayerBoard class.
      Parameters:
      starterCard - takes as parameter the starter card as it is the starting point to place other cards.

  • Method Details

    • updateAvailableResources

      public void updateAvailableResources()
      Updates the availableResources Map every time that a card is added.

    • getAvailableResources

      public Map<Symbol,Integer> getAvailableResources()
      Getter for availableResources. At the moment is not used.
      Returns:
      the map that tracks the available resources.

    • isTileFree

      public boolean isTileFree(int row, int col)
      Returns:
      true if the tile in the given position hasn't been created

    • getTile

      public BoardTile getTile(int row, int col)

    • placeTile

      public BoardTile placeTile(PlaceableCard card, int parentRow, int parentCol, RelativePosition relativePosition) throws InvalidActionException
      When a player places a card, a new tile is created in the corresponding position
      Parameters:
      parentRow - ,ParentCol are the coordinates of the card(tile) whose corner has been covered by the new card
      relativePosition - indicates which corner has been covered
      Throws:
      InvalidActionException

    • isPlaceableTile

      public boolean isPlaceableTile(int row, int col)
      Returns:
      true if one or more of the tiles around the given position have the corresponding corner free

    • isCardCostMet

      public boolean isCardCostMet(PlaceableCard card)
      This method checks if the player has enough resources in his player board to pay the cost of the card. For card with no cost the method returns true.
      Parameters:
      card - is a PlaceableCard containing all the information regarding cards that can be played
      Returns:
      true if the cost is met false otherwise

    • isDeadlocked

      public boolean isDeadlocked()
      Returns:
      true if the board is deadlocked, meaning that no cards can be placed (any placement would cover a forbidden corner), false otherwise

    • getCoords

      public Pair<Integer,Integer> getCoords(RelativePosition relativePosition, int row, int col)
      Calculates and returns the coordinates of a card based on a specified relative position to another card's coordinates.
      Parameters:
      relativePosition - the relative position to the current card
      row - the row index of the current card in the grid
      col - the column index of the current card in the grid
      Returns:
      a Pair object containing the row and column indices of the card at the calculated relative position
